item.title: Scripps Health patients frustrated after May 1 cyber attack
item.description: Cyberattacks are up, in fact security experts said 66% of health care companies cannot meet the minimum security standard defined by the National Institute of Standards and Technology.“The problem is we have an industry with a rapidly growing technical debt,” said Caleb Barlow, CEO, Cynergistek. “Its not that they arent investing in security, they are, they just arent investing fast enough to keep up with an ever moving adversary.“Barlow’s company, Cynergistek, works with healthcare systems before and after a cyber-attack happens.
